greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fourth slice along the 1-2-plane in the cube a(m,n,o) = a(m-1,n,o) + a(m,n-1,o) + a(m,n,o-1) for which the first slice is Pascal's triangle (slice read by antidiagonals).
formula: a(m-1,n,o) + a(m,n-1,o) + a(m,n,o-1) with initialization values a(1,0,0) = 1 and a(m<>1=0, n>=0, 0>=o) = 0.
example: The second row is 1, 4, 10, 20, 35, 56, 84, 120, 165, 220 = A000292, i.e., Tetrahedral (or pyramidal) numbers: binomial(n+2,3) = n(n+1)(n+2)/6 (core).
program: Excel cell formula: =ZS(-1)+Z(-1)S+Z(-15)S where the term Z(-15)S refers to a cell in the previous slice (along the dimension 3), i.e., Z(-15)S corresponds to +a(m,n,o-1).
results.author: _Thomas Wieder_, Aug 06 2006
